Fungal infection.description: A fungal infection occurs when fungi invade a part of the body and cause an infection. Examples include athlete's foot, ringworm, and thrush.
remedies: Keep the affected area clean and dry

Allergy.description: An allergy occurs when the immune system reacts abnormally to a foreign substance such as pollen, pet dander, or certain foods.

GERD.description: Gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) is a chronic condition where stomach acid flows back into the esophagus, causing discomfort.

Chronic cholestasis.description: A condition in which bile flow from the liver is reduced or blocked, leading to liver and digestive issues.

Drug Reaction.description: Adverse reactions to medications, ranging from mild rashes to severe allergic responses.
remedies: Apply soothing creams for skin reactions

Peptic ulcer diseae.description: Sores in the lining of the stomach or the first part of the small intestine.

AIDS.description: Acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS) is a chronic condition caused by HIV, weakening the immune system.

Diabetes.description: A metabolic disorder characterized by high blood sugar levels over a prolonged period.

Gastroenteritis.description: Inflammation of the stomach and intestines, often causing diarrhea, nausea, and vomiting.

Bronchial Asthma.description: A chronic inflammatory disease of the airways causing breathing difficulties.

Hypertension.description: A condition in which the force of the blood against the artery walls is too high.

Migraine.description: A neurological condition characterized by intense headaches, often accompanied by nausea and sensitivity to light.

Cervical spondylosis.description: Age-related wear and tear affecting the spinal disks in the neck.

Paralysis (brain hemorrhage).description: Loss of muscle function in part of the body due to a brain hemorrhage.

Jaundice.description: Yellowing of the skin and eyes due to high bilirubin levels.

Malaria.description: A mosquito-borne infectious disease caused by Plasmodium parasites.

Chicken pox.description: A highly contagious viral infection causing an itchy rash and blisters.

Dengue.description: A mosquito-borne viral infection causing high fever, severe headaches, and joint pains.

Typhoid.description: A bacterial infection spread through contaminated food and water.

hepatitis A.description: A viral liver infection caused by consuming contaminated food or water.

Hepatitis B.description: A viral infection causing liver inflammation, spread through blood or bodily fluids.

Hepatitis C.description: A viral infection that can cause chronic liver disease, spread through infected blood.

Hepatitis D.description: A liver infection that occurs in conjunction with hepatitis B.

Hepatitis E.description: A liver infection spread through contaminated water, typically self-resolving.

Alcoholic hepatitis.description: Liver inflammation caused by excessive alcohol consumption.

Tuberculosis.description: A bacterial infection primarily affecting the lungs, caused by Mycobacterium tuberculosis.

Common Cold.description: A viral infection affecting the nose and throat.

Pneumonia.description: An infection causing inflammation of the air sacs in the lungs.

Dimorphic hemmorhoids(piles).description: Swollen and inflamed veins in the rectum or anus causing discomfort.

Heart attack.description: A medical emergency caused by a blockage in the blood flow to the heart.

Varicose veins.description: Twisted, enlarged veins often appearing on the legs.

Hypothyroidism.description: A condition in which the thyroid gland doesn't produce enough hormones.

Hyperthyroidism.description: A condition in which the thyroid gland produces too much hormone.

Hypoglycemia.description: Low blood sugar levels causing shakiness, confusion, and dizziness.

Osteoarthritis.description: A degenerative joint disease causing pain and stiffness.

Arthritis.description: Inflammation of one or more joints causing pain and stiffness.

(vertigo) Paroymsal Positional Vertigo.description: A sudden sensation of spinning or dizziness caused by head movement.

Acne.description: A common skin condition caused by clogged hair follicles and excess oil production.

Urinary tract infection.description: An infection in any part of the urinary system, often causing pain during urination.
remedies: Avoid irritants like caffeine and alcohol

Psoriasis.description: An autoimmune skin condition causing red, scaly patches.

Impetigo.description: A highly contagious bacterial skin infection causing red sores.
